meanings.definition: Not stained or covered in blood.
meanings.sent1: The white dress remained unbloodied after the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon's hands were unbloodied as he finished the operation.
meanings.sent3: The unbloodied canvas was a relief to the artist who had feared a messy accident.
meanings.sent4: Her unbloodied hands symbolized her innocence in the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The unbloodied snow created a serene and untouched landscape.

meanings.definition: Not having been involved in a fight or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful diplomat remained unbloodied amidst the war-torn countries.
meanings.sent2: The bystander was unbloodied in the bar brawl that erupted last night.
meanings.sent3: The unbloodied student was the only one not caught up in the cafeteria food fight.
meanings.sent4: His unbloodied reputation made him a valuable mediator in the dispute.
meanings.sent5: The unbloodied newcomer was welcomed warmly by the feuding families.
